The 'Serbian Democratic Party' () is a political party in Bosnia and
Herzegovina. It is currently led by Mladen BosiÄ, who succeeded Dragan ÄaviÄ.

The status of the leading party in Republika Srpska and the main Serb party in
Bosnia and Herezovina the SDS lost to the Alliance of Independent Social
Democrats (SNSD), led by the Prime Minister of Republika Srpska Milorad Dodik,
in the parliamentary elections of October 2006.

The Serbian Democratic Party is under sanctions from the United States. The
sanctions prohibit any transfer of funds and material from the U.S. to the SDS
and vice versa. [http://www.epls.gov/epls/search.do?vindex=12&page=1&text=s-
erb+democratic+party&status]

The SDS made major gains in the 2012 elections.
categories: Serb political parties in Bosnia and Herzegovina
